abstract: The JSON representation of the transaction information.
overview:
## Discussion

The [doc://com.apple.storekit/documentation/StoreKit/Transaction/jsonRepresentation] is UTF-8 string data that has the same JSON schema as the [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/AppStoreServerAPI/JWSTransactionDecodedPayload] object. You can use this data to decode the transaction information into your own data type instead of using the [doc://com.apple.storekit/documentation/StoreKit/Transaction] value and its [doc://com.apple.storekit/documentation/StoreKit/transaction-properties] directly.

The JSON Web Signature (JWS) Compact Serialization for the transaction is available in the [doc://com.apple.storekit/documentation/StoreKit/VerificationResult/jwsRepresentation-21vgo] property of the [doc://com.apple.storekit/documentation/StoreKit/VerificationResult]. The JWS string consists of three Base64URL-encoded components, separated by a period: a header, a payload, and a signature. The [doc://com.apple.storekit/documentation/StoreKit/Transaction/jsonRepresentation] is the Base64URL-decoded payload component.

# jsonRepresentation

**Instance Property**

The JSON representation of the transaction information.

## Declaration

```swift
var jsonRepresentation: Data { get }
```

## Discussion

The [doc://com.apple.storekit/documentation/StoreKit/Transaction/jsonRepresentation] is UTF-8 string data that has the same JSON schema as the [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/AppStoreServerAPI/JWSTransactionDecodedPayload] object. You can use this data to decode the transaction information into your own data type instead of using the [doc://com.apple.storekit/documentation/StoreKit/Transaction] value and its [doc://com.apple.storekit/documentation/StoreKit/transaction-properties] directly.

The JSON Web Signature (JWS) Compact Serialization for the transaction is available in the [doc://com.apple.storekit/documentation/StoreKit/VerificationResult/jwsRepresentation-21vgo] property of the [doc://com.apple.storekit/documentation/StoreKit/VerificationResult]. The JWS string consists of three Base64URL-encoded components, separated by a period: a header, a payload, and a signature. The [doc://com.apple.storekit/documentation/StoreKit/Transaction/jsonRepresentation] is the Base64URL-decoded payload component.
title: jsonRepresentation
